title: help with 'docomo' font
content:
Could someone tell which one is it?  
Or alternative? Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052041im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ntt%20docomo_0_5791.png)

Font: 

 similar: HI Chalet Tokyo 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052041/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ntt docomo\_0.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052041/http:/typophile.com/files/ntt%20docomo_0.png) | 61.07 KB |
author: nina nina

comments.content: Don't think it's a font rather a custom logo. [Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052041/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/bauhaus) ITC might provide a pretty close base font though mainly recreating /d (/o + vertical stem), editing its bottom right corner and extending /C bars. More alternative: HI [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052041/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet) Tokyo
Thank you Ryuk! Chalet totally fits.
